4360/A0/05/881/005.status_value: New Law on breast feeding support wich included CRC recommendations and considers the International Code issued in April  2016
4360/A0/05/881/005.indicator_name: Adoption of the International Code on Marketing of Breastmilk substitutes as legislation and subsequent relevant World Health Assembly resolutions
4360/A0/05/881/005.headline: National policies on the Implementation of Development Paediatrics and Early Intervention are endorsed. The newly adopted Law on breastfeeding is aligned with CRC recommendations and International Code of Marketing of Breast Milk Substitutes.
4360/A0/05/881/005.baseline_value: Partial adoption through the National Law on Breastfeeding
4360/A0/05/881/005.target_value: The Law enforcement mechanism is developed

4360/A0/05/881/005.indicator_name: Availability of strong (independent  rigorous and participatory) evidence base for policymaking and programming in the area of nutrition of children and women
4360/A0/05/881/005.headline: National policies on the Implementation of Development Paediatrics and Early Intervention are endorsed. The newly adopted Law on breastfeeding is aligned with CRC recommendations and International Code of Marketing of Breast Milk Substitutes.
4360/A0/05/881/005.baseline_value: Data from the 2012 National Nutrition Study with a focus on anemia and vitamin A deficiency in Turkmenistan and standard nutrition data from the 2015-16 MICS exist  but there is no surveillance data

4360/A0/05/881/005.indicator_name: # of core clinical protocols on DP developed and ready for MOHMI approval
4360/A0/05/881/005.headline: National policies on the Implementation of Development Paediatrics and Early Intervention are endorsed. The newly adopted Law on breastfeeding is aligned with CRC recommendations and International Code of Marketing of Breast Milk Substitutes.

4360/A0/05/884/002.indicator_name: The Government increasingly incorporates country programme results areas benefiting disadvantaged children in midterm strategic planning and budgeting
4360/A0/05/884/002.headline: The country office continued in expanding alliances and engaging into partnerships that promote inclusive child rights agenda at all levels.
4360/A0/05/884/002.baseline_value: Size of public funding for immunization related procurement in 2016-2020

4360/A0/05/884/002.status_value: 20 persons were trained in ToT (9 women  11 men)  representing: -Parliament (members (8) and specialists (4)) -Ministry of Education (1) -National Institute of Education of Turkmenistan (1) -National Institute of Democracy and Human Rights under the President of Turkmenistan (1) -¿Yenme¿ Public Association (1) -Trainers on child rights (2) -UNICEF (2)
4360/A0/05/884/002.indicator_name: ToT for the MPs on CRC and CRPD principles  recommendations and human rights mechanisms
4360/A0/05/884/002.headline: The country office continued in expanding alliances and engaging into partnerships that promote inclusive child rights agenda at all levels.
4360/A0/05/884/002.baseline_value: # of new MPs trained on CRC and CRPD (0)

4360/A0/05/884/002.status_value: A consultative Workshop for children on Child Rights: 32 school children  20 girls and 12 boys participated  4 of them were children with disabilities. Besides  young people and academia has increased theirs awareness on child rights and rights of children with disabilities through public lectures and social media. Students of two major universities shared their aspirations on what they want for every child through the global ¿Tiny stories¿ initiative. Two public lectures on SDGs for Children we
4360/A0/05/884/002.indicator_name: CRC and CRPD workshops in all regions for local level authorities and awareness raising events  for children  including children with disabilities
4360/A0/05/884/002.headline: The country office continued in expanding alliances and engaging into partnerships that promote inclusive child rights agenda at all levels.

4360/A0/05/884/002.status_value: The Advocacy Plan was updated in line with CRC/CRPD recommendations. A number of best practices were documented and will be reflected in 2016 External Annual Report along with MICS findings (due by end of 1 quarter of 2017).
4360/A0/05/884/002.indicator_name: Availability of Advocacy and Communication plan on raising awareness on child wellbeing in line with MICS5 findings  2015 CRC/CRPD Concluding Observations
4360/A0/05/884/002.headline: The country office continued in expanding alliances and engaging into partnerships that promote inclusive child rights agenda at all levels.
4360/A0/05/884/002.baseline_value: The Advocacy Plan exists  but requires update taking into account CRC/CRPD Concluding Observations and latest evidence

4360/A0/05/884/002.status_value: Report on Awareness  perception and knowledge of 12-16 year old children about child rights in general and specifically about their rights to education  participation and social inclusion is available along with the findings (baseline data)
4360/A0/05/884/002.indicator_name: Baseline survey  among 12-16 year old children on child rights principles  including the rights of children with disabilities
4360/A0/05/884/002.headline: The country office continued in expanding alliances and engaging into partnerships that promote inclusive child rights agenda at all levels.

4360/A0/04/009/001.indicator_name: % increase in public expenditure to social sector plans by 2015 as of % of GDP
% increase in public expenditure to socail sector plans by 2015 as of 5 of GDP

4360/A0/04/009/001.status_value: The Government has allocated 8 bln USD for the development of velayats. These expenditures  although targeting infrastructure development  are social in nature as the funds are disbursed against projects such as schools  hospitals  kindergartens  sports facilities and culture. In addition  each velayat has adopted a short term development programme 2012-16.
4360/A0/04/009/001.indicator_name: % changes in expenditure by Velayats in social sector

4360/A0/04/009/003.status_value: Below 20% as per UNFPA survey of 2011
4360/A0/04/009/003.indicator_name: Comprehensive knowledge about HIV prevention among young people

4360/A0/04/009/003.status_value: MICS data will be applied subject to validation

4360/A0/04/009/002.status_value: All 5 velayats and Ashgabat city divisions of the State Statistics Committee  the Ministry of Interior and the Ministry of Health and Medical Industry are using the platform in an adopted form (i.e TurkmenInfo  HealthInfo).
4360/A0/04/009/002.indicator_name: % of line ministries and local authorities using systems for disaggregated data collection and analysis on children

4360/A0/04/009/002.status_value: Report submitted on time.  CO were received in February 2015.

4360/A0/04/009/002.indicator_name: % of line ministries and local authorities using systems fo rdisaggregated data collection and analysis on children

4360/A0/04/009/002.status_value: New Law on Public Health adopted on May 23  2015
4360/A0/04/009/002.indicator_name: # of new laws adopted  related to children and women as part of addressing CRC observations

4360/A0/04/008/001.status_value: There is no population based survey data or reliable official statistics available to track the trend in this indicator. Data of MICS4 conducted in 2012 was not validated  the new population based survey (MICS 5) has been planned for 2016.
The IR indicator has been removed as a result of MTR in 2013.
4360/A0/04/008/001.indicator_name: % of maternal facilities which follow updated protocols on peri-natal care  including PMTCT

4360/A0/04/008/001.status_value: 2 strategic policy documents adopted in 2014 in the field of MCH ¿ the national strategic vision on MNCAH and action plan for 2015-2019  and the MOHMI decree # 166 on improvement of the perinatal care in the country.   2 more policies are under development. One is the PHC policy  which is being updated to optimise the effectiveness of MCH Home visiting services  supported by the detailed HV roadmap and costing of existing and recommended HV modalities developed with UNICEF support for informed d
4360/A0/04/008/001.indicator_name: National PHC MCH and Nutrition policies updated in line with international standards and operational
New WHO  child growth standards are introduced into MOHMI normative documents
Availability of quality evidence for PHC MCH policy update
PHC policy is updated in line with international standars
MCH and Nutrition policies are supported by government  budget allocations
A nutrition surveillance  system is established and made operational
Vitamin A and Fe/FoA supplements are included into the essential drug list for the prophylactic purposes
Updated policy on home visiting at PHC level  with specific focus on remote and most disadvantaged population groups
Bas¿c benef¿t package for ch¿ld care serv¿ces at PHC level developed in line with international standards
Proportion of caregivers providing  adequate complementary  feeding for young chidlren

4360/A0/04/008/003.status_value: 157 children U3 in baby homes  250 in Specialised home for sverely diabled children  368 in two orphanages

4360/A0/05/882/001.status_value: State pre-primary curriculum and parental empowerment programme  were approved by the Government earlier than expected and ready for scaling up
4360/A0/05/882/001.indicator_name: "c2a. Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards - score (1-4)  see guidance"
4360/A0/05/882/001.headline: The Government adopted policies that improve quality of and access to pre-primary education aligned with the best international practices. Capacity-building for institutionalization of the above quality assurance instruments nation-wide is in process.
4360/A0/05/882/001.baseline_value: 1.5 - The Early Learning Development Standards are available but do not include indicators to measure the progress of child development. The early learning curriculum does not include child-friendly measurement tools to ensure school readiness in line with international standards
4360/A0/05/882/001.target_value: 2 - Regional teams of trainers are in place in all regions to lead scaling up of the national pre-primary curriculum document

4360/A0/05/883/002.status_value: A draft concept was shared with stakeholders.  Pending finalization and approval.
4360/A0/05/883/002.indicator_name: Availability of an initial version of social services concept note
4360/A0/05/883/002.headline: The Government is making the rights of the most vulnerable children central in its policy-making creating new policies to create and expand integrated social support services. Social sector is strengthening its role in provision and introducing services for the vulnerable children through pioneering new strategies.
4360/A0/05/883/002.baseline_value: A concept of social servcies is not available at the baseline year.

4360/A0/05/883/002.status_value: Number of CRC/CRPD recommendations were addressed i.e age of marriage  age of children for disability qualification etc. has been unified in accordance with the recommendations.
4360/A0/05/883/002.indicator_name: CRC/CRPD recomendations reflected in the Social Protection Code  overview of the existing legislation and social servcies in light of international social servcies standards of social protection of children and families
4360/A0/05/883/002.headline: The Government is making the rights of the most vulnerable children central in its policy-making creating new policies to create and expand integrated social support services. Social sector is strengthening its role in provision and introducing services for the vulnerable children through pioneering new strategies.
4360/A0/05/883/002.baseline_value: Not reflected. Review of the social protection system commissioned in 2013.

4360/A0/05/883/001.indicator_name: Availability of baseline assesment for SDG indicators adopted by the Government and the measurement system of which UNICEF commited to support
4360/A0/05/883/001.headline: Government representatives and schoolchildren built their capacity in advocating and monitoring of the rights of the child  thereby resulting in generation of baseline data on children's knowledge and perceptions about child rights.
4360/A0/05/883/001.baseline_value: No baseline assesment.  An SDG monitoirng framework was drafted in discussion with the Government  but without reffering to actual values/baselines and discussion about diasaggregation of data

4360/A0/05/883/001.indicator_name: Availability of national data disaggregarted by sex  age and geography on child rights realization  including data on children with disabilities.
4360/A0/05/883/001.headline: Government representatives and schoolchildren built their capacity in advocating and monitoring of the rights of the child  thereby resulting in generation of baseline data on children's knowledge and perceptions about child rights.
4360/A0/05/883/001.baseline_value: Initial agreement of the Governmnet to conduct MICS in 2019

4360/A0/05/883/001.status_value: Both Key Findings and Final reports have been finalized and published on dedicated UNICEF web site.
4360/A0/05/883/001.indicator_name: Finalization and posting of a full 2015-16 MICS report
4360/A0/05/883/001.headline: Government representatives and schoolchildren built their capacity in advocating and monitoring of the rights of the child  thereby resulting in generation of baseline data on children's knowledge and perceptions about child rights.
4360/A0/05/883/001.baseline_value: Last MICS in the country was conducted in 2006. The fieldwork of the 2015/16 MICS was finalized in Jan 2016.
